snippet: The district attorney served justice and common sense in saying he wouldn’t prosecute low-level pot cases.
abstract: Editorial praises Brooklyn District Atty Kenneth Thompson for his decision to no longer prosecute cases in which people are arrested or ticketed for small amounts of marijuana; contends that change will free up resources to fight serious crime and will keep young minority men from getting debilitating criminal records.
lead_paragraph: The district attorney served justice and common sense in saying he wouldn’t prosecute low-level pot cases.

headline.main: A Sensible Marijuana Policy in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: A Sensible Marijuana Policy in Brooklyn
